comment: She's a sweet lady. Good sense of humor. We were not allowed to use calculators which made it difficult. I got an A. You can get any grade you want thanks to the extra credit but be prepared to work for it. The textbook can be found online (saw it last on Reddit). You had to have a perfect score to exempt final :(

Rollson is probably the most ticky tack grader I have ever come across. While she does give partial credit, she takes off for the TINIEST of "errors". You can get every question right on a test and she'll find a mistake somewhere  in the work. There are 4 tests and she gives a ton of extra credit opportunities. Hw is optional but quizzes r over hw

nice lady. Trig is difficult but she explains things very well. Tough grader but you will get used to it. Her tests are 6-10 questions long and you must show all work. I personally always thought they were pretty easy. she gives tons and tons of extra credit points. my grade is awesome because of it! gives hw quizzes every other class period.

You have short quizzes every couple days where you get to use a notecard front and back as a cheat sheet. HER TESTS ARE HARD. She gives homework every night but it is not mandatory. You need to be in class everyday and print out the notes.
Very sweet lady. Grades a little tough for my taste. You must show and prove all of your work even if it can be done in your head so that's a bit annoying. Once you learn her style you'll pass.

This professor really cares that you understand. She explains very well. I think the way she taught me trig is really helping me in calculus. You do need to come to this class because there are quizzes but mostly because she really is there to make things clearer.

I hadn't taken a math course in almost 10 years and I came out with an A. She is a great teacher who really breaks the concepts down and explains them so well. I will say that I didattempted every single homework problem she suggested. This really helped. She has her notes that she uses that are awesome. I used the book for the homework.

Mrs. Rollason was a great teacher and taught Math1102 very well. I understood everything and if I didn't, all I needed to do was ask her and she would help me understand. she gave us ALOT of extra credit opportunities and after each of the three tests we could do test corrections for extra credit. The extra credit was not hard either.

She's an awesome person. However, her class is something you have to work for. She gives you tons of opportunities to get extra credit which helps a lot. She is a VERY picky grader. She wants you to understand and learn, not memorize so she goes out of her way to explain things in that aspect. It's not an easy A if you don't do homework.
Her attitude can be a bit much and she can be rude but overall, it's pretty easy if you do everything she says. There's a lot of extra credit.

Easiest A I've made in college so far. Gives opportunity for TEN extra credit points to your FINAL grade. Do your homework, do the packets she gives you and you will without a doubt make an A. She's one of the sweetest, nicest professors I've ever had. TAKE HER!

DO YOUR HW!! it helps trust me,don't miss class unless you really have too. She will explain any questions you might have clearly during class or during office hrs. You will PASS !! (Note:if you do those things. ) GL

Mrs. Rollason is a awesome teacher she gives you every possible chance to pass from the 10 points extra credit to her reading quizes if you really struggle at math you should take her she helps you understand it and gives you many chances to succeed TAKE HER!!!

She explains things in a way that I can understand them. She doesn't require MyMathLab. She puts note outlines on D2L. She helped me out when I'd went to her office hours. I like the extra credit opportunities. I really feel like she wants me to do well and gives me every opportunity to try to show her that I know the content. She is a hard grader.

She has extra credit. She makes you explain everything and gives partial credit on tests, but marks off for missing notation or not writing it in the form she wants. She puts note outlines online, but you have to go to class to fill them in. She uses different examples than the textbook. Take her if you are okay with working hard for a good grade.
